column5: That's very stand up, and a solid way to take care of your customers. Well done, Ted!!!

Just got the word from Frog Rapids Camp. While the website isn’t yet updated, Adele assured me the policy is the same as last year. If the border opens, and you’re comfortable going, your reservation is there. If you choose to roll over instead or if the border is closed, she will be rolling over deposits to next year. As a reminder, the opener is later next year so resultant rollover weeks will be a week later than they are this year.

Much as I'd like to see everybody's thoughts on vaccinations, or not, I'd like to see if we can't actually use the thread to talk about what camps are doing with reservations rather than see this get nuked like so many other have. On point, please.
Ian at Five Lakes Lodge moved our May week into September. If that doesn't happen, it rolls back over to May 2022.

Hawk Lake Lodge (me) is rolling everything forward** just like last year. Also existing reservations are locked in at the rate when booking (if the rates change in the future). And finally if you booked in 2019 or 2020 and had a child rate we will honor that rate even if they have crossed into a different category (e.g. booked in 2019 with a 14 year old at half price and they are now 16/17 and would be at a higher rate under normal years). Cheers -FT ** Note that the customer has to move the reservation to next year. As we don't have set check-in dates or length of stay its on them to determine the date of a future trip.
